solution_line_template: Jake delivers {jake_weekly_newspapers} x {weeks_in_month} = <<{jake_weekly_newspapers}*{weeks_in_month}={jake_monthly_newspapers}>>{jake_monthly_newspapers} newspapers in a month.

Miranda delivers {jake_weekly_newspapers} x {multiplier_for_miranda} = <<{jake_weekly_newspapers}*{multiplier_for_miranda}={miranda_weekly_newspapers}>>{miranda_weekly_newspapers} newspapers in a week.
So she delivers {miranda_weekly_newspapers} x {weeks_in_month} = <<{miranda_weekly_newspapers}*{weeks_in_month}={miranda_monthly_newspapers}>>{miranda_monthly_newspapers} newspapers in a month.

Hence, Miranda delivers {miranda_monthly_newspapers} - {jake_monthly_newspapers} = <<{miranda_monthly_newspapers}-{jake_monthly_newspapers}={difference_monthly_newspapers}>>{difference_monthly_newspapers} newspapers more than Jake in a month.
